title: Report launch | “No Internet Means No Work, No Pay, No Food"
selftext:
On June 14, 2023, Human Rights Watch and IFF launched their joint report **“No Internet Means No Work, No Pay, No Food": Internet Shutdowns Deny Access to Basic Rights in "Digital India."** 

The report sheds lights on a fundamental conflict in the Government’s push for “Digital India''— even as digitalisation & platformisation make internet access vital for everyday life, state governments and the Union Government continue to impose shutdowns arbitrarily, erratically, unnecessarily, and disproportionately, and in the process, denying millions access to basic rights and entitlements guaranteed by the Constitution. 

Read the full report here: [https://www.hrw.org/report/2023/06/14/no-internet-means-no-work-no-pay-no-food/internet-shutdowns-deny-access-basic](https://www.hrw.org/report/2023/06/14/no-internet-means-no-work-no-pay-no-food/internet-shutdowns-deny-access-basic)

Read the [English](https://www.hrw.org/news/2023/06/13/india-internet-shutdowns-hurt-vulnerable-communities) and [Hindi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nqk8lbYNfqw) Press release. 

# Virtual Launch Event | 14th June - 7:00 PM IST 

[Register now](https://hrworg.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_cRDVCVJYSju39Q0nzuS1lQ) 

https://preview.redd.it/sxsx6bzw8y5b1.png?width=1600&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=923c3681c26d07c068ba7101d9ecc50a00b17077

[Register now](https://hrworg.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_cRDVCVJYSju39Q0nzuS1lQ) 

The panel includes:

* Vineet Bhambhu, member of the Mazdoor Kisan Shakti Sangathan;
* Tim Engelhardt, Human Rights Officer, Thematic Engagement, Special Procedures and Right to Development Division, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights; 
* Apar Gupta, Founding Director of IFF; and 
* Jayshree Bajoria, Associate Director, Asia, Human Rights Watch. 

*The panel will be moderated by Rohini Lakshané, Technologist and Researcher.* 

Help us continue fighting internet shutdowns. [Become an IFF member today.](https://internetfreedom.in/donate)
comments:
We are fighting wrongly

We need to fight for the making the data to be public and announced every time the internet shutdown happens 

With the info , what domains , what area , what services are impacted , what is the period of shutdown, who issued the order and why it was okayed. 


Only when this law gets passed we can fight the above thing
It's such a shame that on one hand India is pushing digitization and on the other leading in internet shutdowns.

We have had a similar issue, as we are working in a sector in Jodhpur-Barmer. Where getting internet was struggle to begin with and with internet outage it was a crime for us not being able to help the artisans.

Thank you. Finally someone put this out.

We cannot both push for a digital India and then shut that shit down.

If the internet was shut down today for me, i would lose my job, i won't be able to access ANY MONEY, and wtf am i gonna do then?

The government has NO PLAN OR INTENTION to feed me, why should I on their whim suffer this?

And the best part is, the banks.

The banks will still want their fucking emi won't they. The rest of the world was dying but they needed their emi paid right. Even tho hey, let's let billions of dollars be stolen, but how dare this idiot not pay his 3k a month emi. I will go and make his life hell. 

The government should be held liable for all this. You can't push for a digital India then punish us. That's like new age fascism, because if they wanna punish us or make us wanna listen, they will just shut the internet down.
